choice.&lt;standard command&gt;.name: choice.<standard command>
choice.&lt;standard command&gt;.description: The subsections associated with this main section are executed for the specified command. You can enable standard commands and specify form commands from the session Sessions (ttadv2500m000). A list of standard commands appears at the end of this help topic. For form commands, the session, menu or function name is used.

before.choice.name: before.choice
before.choice.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed immediately before the specified command is executed. You can use this subsection, for example, to test data before the command process continues. You can use the choice.again() function to stop the command.

on.choice.name: on.choice
on.choice.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed when the specified command is activated. These actions are executed instead of the standard action associated with the command. This subsection is not always available. For details, see the list at the end of this help topic.

after.choice.name: after.choice
after.choice.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed immediately after the specified command has been executed. This subsection is not available for the end.program and abort.program commands.

field.&lt;field name&gt;.name: field.<field name>
field.&lt;field name&gt;.description: The subsections associated with this main section are executed for the specified field. The field name you specify must correspond with the name on the form.

field.all.name: field.all
field.all.description: The subsections associated with this main section are executed for all fields on the form

field.other.name: field.other
field.other.description: A subsection associated with this section is executed for all fields for which the particular subsection has not been programmed in a field.<field name> section.

init.field.name: init.field
init.field.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed the first time that the form on which the field occurs becomes current. The subsection is executed immediately before the init.form section of the form. You can use this section to change field attributes.

before.field.name: before.field
before.field.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed each time the focus moves to the specified field. The subsection is executed immediately before the before.input or before.display subsections.

before.input.name: before.input
before.input.description: This section is supported for backward compatibility only. The actions programmed in this subsection are executed immediately before input to an input field commences. In Infor ERP Enterprise programs, use enable.fields() and disable.fields() in the when.field.changes of another field to enable and disable fields.

before.display.name: before.display
before.display.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed each time that the specified field is displayed. You can use this subsection, for example, to set the value of a display field or to change the output format of currencies and dates (by using attr.oformat$ ).

selection.filter.name: selection.filter
selection.filter.description: In this section you can set the query extensions for filtering the selection. (See query.extend.where() ). This section is triggerd when a zoom process is started or when autocomplete is started on the specified field. If this section was triggered by the start of a zoom process, the before.zoom section is called hereafter immediately.

before.zoom.name: before.zoom
before.zoom.description: When a zoom process is started on the specified field, the actions programmed in this subsection are executed immediately before the zoom process is executed. You can use this subsection to change the zoom attributes. For example, in the field definition in the form manager, a default zoom code can be specified. You can then use this subsection to change the zoom code (by setting the predefined variable attr.zoomcode ). In order to cancel the zoom, use the input.again() function.

before.checks.name: before.checks
before.checks.description: For non-enum fields the actions programmed in this subsection are executed when the field looses focus. I.e.: the TAB key has been pressed or the user clicked on another field. The subsection is executed immediately before the domain and references are checked. You can use this section, for example, to change the value of the field before the domain and reference checks.

domain.error.name: domain.error
domain.error.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed if the domain check causes an error after data has been entered in the field. You can use this section to provide your own error message instead of the standard message.

ref.input.name: ref.input
ref.input.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed if a reference error occurs. If you program this section, the 4GL engine does not display a message.

ref.display.name: ref.display
ref.display.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed if there is an error in the reference display.

check.input.name: check.input
check.input.description: This section is replaced by Data Access Layer functionality (if a DAL exists for the table).

on.input.name: on.input
on.input.description: This section is supported for backward compatibility. Functionality has been replaced by Form Commands.

when.field.changes.name: when.field.changes
when.field.changes.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed when the new value entered in the specified field differs from the old value.

after.zoom.name: after.zoom
after.zoom.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed when the zoom process on a specified field ends. You can use this subsection, for example, to redisplay any field that has changed as a result of the zoom process.

after.input.name: after.input
after.input.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed after all checks have been performed on input to the specified field and after the when.field.changes subsection has been executed. In this subsection, you can use the to.field() function if the sequence deviates from the default.

after.display.name: after.display
after.display.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed just after display of the specified field. You can use this subsection, for example, to read reference tables.

after.field.name: after.field
after.field.description: This is the last subsection for a field. The actions programmed in this subsection are executed after input to or display of the specified field. This section is always executed, even if the user left the field by pressing ESC, one of the arrow keys, or a mouse button. You can use this subsection to perform special actions before leaving the field.

form.all.name: form.all
form.all.description: The subsections associated with this section are executed for all forms of the session.

form.other.name: form.other
form.other.description: A subsection associated with this section is executed for all forms for which the particular subsection has not been programmed in a form.<form number section.

init.form.name: init.form
init.form.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed the first time the specified form becomes current, immediately before the subsection before.form . You use this subsection to program the first action to be performed by the system ï¿½ a first.set or first.view , for example.

before.form.name: before.form
before.form.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed each time the user navigates to the form.

after.form.name: after.form
after.form.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed each time the user navigates away from the form.

group.&lt;group number&gt;.name: group.<group number>
group.&lt;group number&gt;.description: This section defines the group for which the actions programmed in the group subsections are executed. The group number is automatically generated when the group is created and can be obtained from the DFE .

init.group.name: init.group
init.group.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed only the first time the group becomes active, immediately before the before.group subsection. You use this subsection to program the first action to be performed by the system when the group becomes active. When the group is split across two or more forms (because not all the group fits on one form or because it is a repeating group), this subsection is executed the first time that the first form on which the group occurs becomes current.

before.group.name: before.group
before.group.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed each time the specified group becomes active. When the group is split across more than one form, this subsection is executed whenever any form on which it occurs becomes current.

after.group.name: after.group
after.group.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed each time the form on which the group occurs is ended. When the group is split across more than one form, this section is executed whenever any form on which the group occurs is ended.

read.view.name: read.view
read.view.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed immediately after a view action on the main table (start.set, first.view, next.view, prev.view or last.view). You can use this subsection to call disable.commands()

before.read.name: before.read
before.read.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed immediately before each read action on the main table.

after.read.name: after.read
after.read.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed after each read action on the main table.

before.delete.name: before.delete
before.delete.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed immediately before each delete action on the main table.

after.delete.name: after.delete
after.delete.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed immediately after each delete action on the main table. You can use this subsection, for example, for deleting references, if this is not done automatically.

after.skip.delete.name: after.skip.delete
after.skip.delete.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed if a delete action on the main table has been skipped as a result of actions programmed in the before.delete subsection. The actions are executed immediately after the skip action.

declaration.name: declaration
declaration.description: Use this section to declare tables and global variables that you want to use in other sections in the script. See Declarations and Tables for details of the declaration syntax. You also use this section to define macros and function prototypes. You can put your #idents for solution identification here as well.

before.program.name: before.program
before.program.description: Use this section to program actions that must be executed when the session starts. For example, you can use this section to initialize or import variables or to read a special record.

after.form.read.name: after.form.read
after.form.read.description: Use this section to change form data at run time after it has been read in memory. Typical functionality is the removal of fields, groups or commands

on.error.name: on.error
on.error.description: Use this section to program actions that must be executed at the end of the session, before the after.program section. If the session is canceled, the actions in this section are not executed. If an error is detected, you can check the predefined variable e for the error code.

after.program.name: after.program
after.program.description: Use this section to program actions that must be executed at the end of the session, after the on.error section.

after.update.db.commit.name: after.update.db.commit
after.update.db.commit.description: Use this section to program actions that must be executed immediately after a after.commit.transaction() call, if the database is updated.

before.display.object.name: before.display.object
before.display.object.description: Use this section to program actions that must be executed each time the entire record is displayed.

before.new.object.name: before.new.object
before.new.object.description: Use this section to program actions that must be executed once before the input of the first field of the new created record. It is used for setting the default values of the record fields.

on.display.total.line.name: on.display.total.line
on.display.total.line.description: Use this section to calculate and display the total line fields. The function display.total.fields() must be called from this section to display the actual total fields values. This section will be called when the variable fattr.total.line is set in the before.program section. By default the 4GL-Engine will call this section after a (new) set of records is read from the database. In addition an application can trigger this section to be called by calling the function: refresh.total.line() .

functions.name: functions
functions.description: Use this section to define the functions used in the other sections. This must be the last section in the script. The function syntax is the same as for 3GL programming language features: overview .

zoom.from.&lt;zoom name&gt;.name: zoom.from.<zoom name>
zoom.from.&lt;zoom name&gt;.description: Each field has a name that can be used as a zoom name. You can specify the zoom name in this main section. The zoom name indicates which field the current session was zoomed from (when the subprocess is started from a form command, the zoom name is "choice"). The subsections associated with this main section are executed when the current process was zoomed to from the specified process.

zoom.from.all.name: zoom.from.all
zoom.from.all.description: The subsections associated with this main section are executed for all processes from which the current session can be zoomed to.

zoom.from.other.name: zoom.from.other
zoom.from.other.description: A subsection associated with this section is executed for all processes for which the particular subsection has not been programmed in a zoom.from.<zoom name> section.

on.entry.name: on.entry
on.entry.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed each time the current process is started from the specified process(es). You can use this subsection to import variables.

on.exit.name: on.exit
on.exit.description: The actions programmed in this subsection are executed at the end of the current process, if the current process was started from the process(es) specified in the main section. You can use this subsection to export variables.

attr.adju.name: attr.adju
attr.adju.description: "l" align left "r" align right "c" align center

attr.bitset.mask.name: attr.bitset.mask
attr.bitset.mask.description:
In general: bitsets are deprecated in the UI. The
                        available values for a bitset field (see also Enumerates overview and synopsis ).

attr.changed.name: attr.changed
attr.changed.description: Indicates if the current field has changed.

attr.conv.name: attr.conv
attr.conv.description: "u" convert to upper case "l" convert to lower case

attr.currkey.name: attr.currkey
attr.currkey.description: true current field is a key field false current field is not a key field

attr.dbase.name: attr.dbase
attr.dbase.description: true current field is a database field false current field is not a database field

attr.deflt$.name: attr.deflt$
attr.deflt$.description:
Default value of current field.
                        When the TIV level is less than 2040 ,
                        then the length of this string is 100.

attr.diga.name: attr.diga
attr.diga.description:
Number of digits after decimal sign. For strings,
                        this is the maximum input length.

attr.digv.name: attr.digv
attr.digv.description: Number of digits before decimal sign.

attr.divf.name: attr.divf
attr.divf.description:
Division factor. (For entering numeric values
                        without a decimal point.)

attr.domm$.name: attr.domm$
attr.domm$.description: Domain message code of current field.

attr.dorp.name: attr.dorp
attr.dorp.description: Fill field with default or previous value: DORP.PREVIOUS (0) use the previous value DORP.DEFAULT (1) use the default value

attr.echo.name: attr.echo
attr.echo.description:
true display value on form false do not display value on form This variable is supported for backward
                           compatibility only. In preference, use the inputfield.visible() , inputfield.invisible() and inputfield.password() functions.

attr.element.name: attr.element
attr.element.description:
Current array index (if field is an array
                        element).

attr.enum.mask$.name: attr.enum.mask$
attr.enum.mask$.description:
The values available for an enumerate field. Also
                           the enumerate values available for the ask.enum() function. See also set.enum.values.for.field() function.

attr.format.addition$.name: attr.format.addition$
attr.format.addition$.description:
Currency to be used for an amount format. Language
                        to be used for a date format.

attr.inpfld.name: attr.inpfld
attr.inpfld.description: 0 display field 1 input field 2 input only field 3 display only field

attr.input.name: attr.input
attr.input.description:
false input disabled true input enabled This variable is supported for backward
                           compatibility only. In preference, use disable.fields() and enable.fields() functions.

attr.maxlen.name: attr.maxlen
attr.maxlen.description: Maximum display length of current field.

attr.message$.name: attr.message$
attr.message$.description:
Message to be displayed when a field is filled after
                        a before.input event.

attr.multioccur.name: attr.multioccur
attr.multioccur.description: true multioccurrence field false not multioccurrence field

attr.nowait$.name: attr.nowait$
attr.nowait$.description:
Characters that start a field command. This variable
                        is supported for backward compatibility only. In Infor
                        ERP Enterprise, field command functionality is replaced by form
                        commands.

attr.permission.name: attr.permission
attr.permission.description: Permissions for current field: NO.PERMISSION 1 PERM.READ 2 PERM.MODIFY 4 PERM.WRITE 8 PERM.DELETE 16 NO.RESTRICTION 30 PERM.UNKNOWN 32 NO.PERM.DEFINED 64 See also db.permission() function.

attr.rang$.name: attr.rang$
attr.rang$.description:
Defines a range; values are automatically checked
                        against this range.

attr.rotate.name: attr.rotate
attr.rotate.description: Current index in currency table (see set.currencies() function).

attr.textfield$.name: attr.textfield$
attr.textfield$.description:
Name of the text field. Used by the Text
                        Manager.

attr.textkw1$ to attr.textkw4$.name: attr.textkw1$ to attr.textkw4$
attr.textkw1$ to attr.textkw4$.description: Keywords of text. Used by the Text Manager. The output string is multibyte.

attr.textlang$.name: attr.textlang$
attr.textlang$.description:
Language for text editing. Used by the Text
                        Manager.

attr.textmaxlines.name: attr.textmaxlines
attr.textmaxlines.description:
Maximum number of lines in the text editor. Used by
                        the Text Manager.

attr.textmode.name: attr.textmode
attr.textmode.description: 1 display mode 3 read/write mode Used by the Text Manager.

attr.textopt$.name: attr.textopt$
attr.textopt$.description:
Name of default option for editor window options.
                        Used by the Text Manager.

attr.textstart.name: attr.textstart
attr.textstart.description:
true When new text is created, start text manager
                                    directly (default). false When new text is created, fill keywords
                                    first. Used by the Text Manager.

attr.textzoomsession$.name: attr.textzoomsession$
attr.textzoomsession$.description:
Session zoomed to by text editor zoom command. The
                        default is "Display Texts" session. Used by the Text
                        Manager.

attr.type.name: attr.type
attr.type.description:
Database type (DB.ENUM, DB.STRING, DB.TIME, DB.DATE,
                        and so on)

attr.zoomcode.name: attr.zoomcode
attr.zoomcode.description: Field zoomcode. Possible values are: 0 No zoom Z.MENU (1) Zoom to a menu Z.SESSION (2) Zoom to a session

attr.zoomreturn$.name: attr.zoomreturn$
attr.zoomreturn$.description:
Name of return field of zoom session on current
                        field.

attr.zoomindex.name: attr.zoomindex
attr.zoomindex.description:
Number of table-index to start session zoomed to
                        from a field.

auto.nextform.name: auto.nextform
auto.nextform.description:
true When modifying form data, automatically
                                    display next form when all occurrences on current
                                    form have been filled. false When modifying form data, do not
                                    automatically display next form when all
                                    occurrences on current form have been filled
                                    (default). It is not good GUI practice to use this
                           variable.

background.name: background
background.description: true current session is modal false current session is modeless

before.update.check.name: before.update.check
before.update.check.description: true field is checked during update false field is checked during input Valid only in subsection check.input .

break.view.name: break.view
break.view.description:
When searching for records in type 3 forms, break to
                        next view when no records found and group fields match
                        with old values. (true or false).

chm.user.name: chm.user
chm.user.description: Name of user of current chart.

curr.key.name: curr.key
curr.key.description:
Current key number of main table. Not available in
                        before.program.

dal.error.file.name: dal.error.file
dal.error.file.description:
The name of the source file where the last
                        dal.set.error.message was called. This variable can be
                        used in the debugger. If you trace this variable, the
                        debugger will stop when the function dal.set.error.message(), dal.set.warning.message(), dal.set.info.message() has been called.

dal.error.line.name: dal.error.line
dal.error.line.description:
The line number in the code where the last
                        dal.set.error.message was called. See dal.error.file
                        above.

dis.parent.name: dis.parent
dis.parent.description:
Identification number of the (original) parent process. If the session is
                        			   restarted due to dynamic index switching, it still points to the original parent process.

dis.restarted.name: dis.restarted
dis.restarted.description:
Indicates whether the session is restarted due to
                        dynamic index switching (true or false).

dynamic.index.switching.name: dynamic.index.switching
dynamic.index.switching.description:
Can be set in before.program for non-integrated
                           sessions. Indicates the way the session should use
                           	    dynamic index switching. Possible values: This functionality is deprecated.
                           		Dynamic index switching should be enabled in the session properties.
                           		If a session only enables Dynamic Index Switching in the before.program section this will not work in WebUI and LN UI. 0 No dynamic index switching. -1 Restart when view fields differ. -2 Always restart session when switching
                                    indices.

e.name: e
e.description: Error code of last file action.

error.bypass.name: error.bypass
error.bypass.description:
Indicates which database errors can be detected in
                        your program script, see the Database operations overview for a detailed description.

exit.val$.name: exit.val$
exit.val$.description:
String returned to the called program at the end of
                        the process.

fattr.helpfile$.name: fattr.helpfile$
fattr.helpfile$.description: Name of help file for current form.

fattr.init.name: fattr.init
fattr.init.description: Indicates if the form has been initialized.

fattr.nrtabs.name: fattr.nrtabs
fattr.nrtabs.description:
Number of tabs on current form (dynamic forms
                        only).

fattr.occurnr.name: fattr.occurnr
fattr.occurnr.description: Number of occurrences on current form.

fattr.seqno.name: fattr.seqno
fattr.seqno.description: Sequence number of current field in form.

fattr.toplines.name: fattr.toplines
fattr.toplines.description:
The number of lines above the multioccurrence fields
                        (default: 3). Set in the before.program section.

fattr.total.line.name: fattr.total.line
fattr.total.line.description:
If set in before.program section, this
                        indicates that a total line must be displayed in the
                        grid (see also display.total.fields() ). Can have the values true
                        or false.

firstweek$.name: firstweek$
firstweek$.description:
Date of the first day in the first week of the
                        current year.

form.next.name: form.next
form.next.description: Next form number. -1 if no next form

form.prev.name: form.prev
form.prev.description: Previous form number. -1 if no previous form

graphical.mode.name: graphical.mode
graphical.mode.description:
Indicates whether the 3GL program runs in graphical
                        mode (true) or in character mode (false). Default is
                        false.

ignore.first.event.name: ignore.first.event
ignore.first.event.description:
Indicates whether the start command of the current
                        session must be skipped. The start command is defined
                        in the session data.

job.device.name: job.device
job.device.description: Default device used by job process.

job.device.requested.name: job.device.requested
job.device.requested.description:
Indicates whether an output device must be specified
                        when in job mode.

job.process.name: job.process
job.process.description: Indicates if process is started by a job.

job.process.error.name: job.process.error
job.process.error.description:
Indicates if an error occurred during the run of a
                        job.

job.report.name: job.report
job.report.description:
Report code of report to be used when in job
                        mode.

job.skip.date.question.name: job.skip.date.question
job.skip.date.question.description:
Indicates if the question "Consider the difference
                        between entered date and system date?" must be
                        skipped.

job.change.data.name: job.change.data
job.change.data.description: Indicates if the session has been started by the Change Job option Available from Tools Interface Version (TIV) TIV 1900

logname$.name: logname$
logname$.description: Current BAAN user name, which need not be identical to the OS user name.

mark.table().name: mark.table()
mark.table().description:
This array indicates which occurences are
                           			marked. The size of this array is set to fattr.occurnr . For example, if records 3 and 8 are marked,
                           			then: mark.table(3) = true mark.table(8) = true and other elements in the array are false. Note that from Tools Interface Version (TIV) TIV 1075 records outside the current window can be selected
                              		as well. These are not indicated as selected in the
                              		mark.table array. Read the Record selection Overview for more information.

marked.name: marked
marked.description:
Indicates the marked record. If multiple records
                           			are marked then this indicates the first one
                           			marked. Deprecated from Tools Interface Version (TIV) TIV 1075 .

max.formtabs.name: max.formtabs
max.formtabs.description:
Defines the maximum number of form tabs to be
                        displayed. Set in the before.program section.

modify.prim.key.name: modify.prim.key
modify.prim.key.description:
true Primary key can be modified during modify.
                                    Set in programs of type 1, 2, and 3. false Primary key cannot be modified.

number.forms.name: number.forms
number.forms.description: Number of forms within current session.

number.of.marks.name: number.of.marks
number.of.marks.description: Number of selected records in the grid. Note that from Tools Interface Version (TIV) TIV 1075 you can also use sel.num.selected()

previous.choice.name: previous.choice
previous.choice.description: Possible values: 0 add.set dupl.occur modify.set mark.delete global.copy global.delete Valid only in field sections and main.table.io .

procesinfo$.name: procesinfo$
procesinfo$.description: Information passed to program at startup.

query.extension.name: query.extension
query.extension.description:
A condition that is added to the WHERE clause of a
                        query to be parsed by the 4GL engine (using AND operator). Set in before.program section. In preference, use the query.extend functions.

reportno.name: reportno
reportno.description:
Reports are numbered (1..n) within a report group.
                           This number indicates the sequence number within
                           the report group. Note: The numbers (labeled "No.") in the session
                           "Reports by Session" only match with reportno if these
                           numbers are consecutive.

select.only.fields.on.form.name: select.only.fields.on.form
select.only.fields.on.form.description:
true all reference tables are read (default) false only reference tables of fields on form are
                                    read Use in before.program section.

session.zoomindex.name: session.zoomindex
session.zoomindex.description:
Number of table-index to start session started with
                        start.session or start.synchronized.child.

session.nr.view.fields.name: session.nr.view.fields
session.nr.view.fields.description:
Dynamic index switching sessions only: number of
                        view fields to show in started session started with
                        start.session or start.synchronized.child. Use this in
                        combination with session.zoomindex.

ssi.import.running.name: ssi.import.running
ssi.import.running.description:
Boolean indicating if an Import from Excel is currently running. Questions and dialogs during Import from Excel cause a session to hang. Use this variable to check if a question or a dialog
                           must be skipped.

ssi.export.running.name: ssi.export.running
ssi.export.running.description: Boolean indicating if an Export to Excel is currently running.

stp.abort.error.name: stp.abort.error
stp.abort.error.description: Boolean indicating if the function abort.io() has been called.

stp.check.input.error.name: stp.check.input.error
stp.check.input.error.description: Boolean indicating if the function set.input.error() has been called. Valid only in check.input section.

stp.skip.error.name: stp.skip.error
stp.skip.error.description: Boolean indicating if the function skip.io() has been called.

subdal.name: subdal
subdal.description:
Indicates if the invocation of this Data Access Layer was caused by another DAL. Note that subdal is true does not necessarily mean that its table is a child table of the invoking
                        DAL's table.

synchronized.reason.name: synchronized.reason
synchronized.reason.description:
This indicates the command that started the dialog
                        synchronization. In case of MMT the satelites react on the synchronized reason of 
                        the parent to startup in the same mode ()including dis/enabling commands)

description: 0 DISPLAY.SET ADD.SET MODIFY.SET DUPL.OCCUR END.PROGRAM ABORT.PROGRAM

update.status.name: update.status
update.status.description: 0 no update ADD.SET during add MODIFY.SET during modify MARK.DELETE during delete

text.updated.in.edit.name: text.updated.in.edit
text.updated.in.edit.description: Boolean indicating that the text is updated during the edit

user.type$.name: user.type$
user.type$.description: Current type of user. Possible values are: S         super user N         normal user

zoomfield$.name: zoomfield$
zoomfield$.description:
Variable set in the zoom session, indicating which
                        field in the parent session was zoomed from.

zoomreturn$.name: zoomreturn$
zoomreturn$.description:
Variable set in the zoom session, indicating which
                        field's value is to be returned. In the parent session,
                        the variable attr.zoomreturn$ has the same
                        value.
